headline.print_headline: Indonesia Counter-Terrorism Forces Foil Plot to Bomb State Palace: Police
headline.main: Indonesia Counter-Terrorism Forces Foil Plot to Bomb State Palace: Police

snippet: Indonesian counter-terrorism forces on Saturday arrested three people near the capital Jakarta suspected of planning a bomb attack on the presidential palace, a police spokesman said....
lead_paragraph: Indonesian counter-terrorism forces on Saturday arrested three people near the capital Jakarta suspected of planning a bomb attack on the presidential palace, a police spokesman said.

headline.print_headline: India Citizen in US Pleads Guilty to Terrorism Conspiracy
headline.main: India Citizen in US Pleads Guilty to Terrorism Conspiracy

snippet: A citizen of India who received asylum in the U.S. and lived in northern Nevada has pleaded guilty to conspiring to plot a terror strike in the Punjab region of his home country on the border with Pakistan, federal law enforcement officials said T...
lead_paragraph: A citizen of India who received asylum in the U.S. and lived in northern Nevada has pleaded guilty to conspiring to plot a terror strike in the Punjab region of his home country on the border with Pakistan, federal law enforcement officials said Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Terrorism Suspected in Car-And-Knife Attack at Ohio State
headline.main: Terrorism Suspected in Car-And-Knife Attack at Ohio State

snippet: A Somali-born Ohio State University student plowed his car into a group of pedestrians on campus and then got out and began stabbing people with a butcher knife Monday before he was shot to death by a police officer. Police said they were investig...
lead_paragraph: A Somali-born Ohio State University student plowed his car into a group of pedestrians on campus and then got out and began stabbing people with a butcher knife Monday before he was shot to death by a police officer. Police said they were investigating whether it was a terrorist attack.

snippet: President Obama defended his strategy to fight ISIS, emphasizing the need to take a “long view” of the threat of terrorism....

headline.print_headline: Obama, Defending Legacy, Warns Against ‘Elevating’ Terrorists
headline.main: Obama, in Major National Security Speech, Defends Counterterrorism Legacy

snippet: Speaking at MacDill Air Force Base, President Obama defended his approach to fighting wars while thwarting terrorist plots and protecting civil liberties....

lead_paragraph: Speaking at MacDill Air Force Base, President Obama defended his approach to fighting wars while thwarting terrorist plots and protecting civil liberties.

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Tampa, and Charlie Savage from Washington.
byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and CHARLIE SAVAGE

headline.print_headline: American  Who Died in Syria  Is Identified
headline.main: Scott Dayton Identified as First American to Die in Syria Combat

snippet: Chief Dayton, who lived in Virginia and was assigned to a bomb-disposal unit, was killed in northern Syria on Thursday by an improvised bomb....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

abstract: Senior Chief Petty Officer Scott C Dayton, Navy sailor and recipient of military honors including Bronze Star, is identified as first member of American armed forces to be killed in combat in Syria.
lead_paragraph: Chief Dayton, who lived in Virginia and was assigned to a bomb-disposal unit, was killed in northern Syria on Thursday by an improvised bomb.

headline.main: We Don’t Talk About ‘Radicalization’ When an Attacker Isn’t Muslim. We Should.

headline.print_headline: France Expands Its Rules Allowing Police to Carry Guns While Off Duty
headline.main: France Eases Rules for Police to Carry Guns While Off Duty

snippet: The move came in response to an attack on Monday in which an Islamic State operative fatally stabbed a police officer and his companion at their home....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: France relaxes gun rule in order to permit off-duty police offers to carry their guns even if country is not in midst of state of emergency; change follows fatal stabbing of police officer and his companion by Islamic State group assailant.
lead_paragraph: The move came in response to an attack on Monday in which an Islamic State operative fatally stabbed a police officer and his companion at their home.

byline.contributor: Milan Schreuer contributed reporting from Magnanville, France.

headline.print_headline: Old Political Tactic Is Revived:  Exploiting Fear, Not Easing It
headline.main: Donald Trump Responds to Orlando Attack by Exploiting Fear, Not Easing It

snippet: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises....
abstract: Comments by Donald Trump in aftermath of Orlando shooting show he is committed not only to use of fear, political tactic that has old American pedigree, but also to raising stakes by demonizing entire religious group; Trump's speech includes warning that Muslim immigrants could bring about end of country itself; Hillary Clinton, by contrast, emphasizes need for unity in speech following massacre, but both presidential candidates have been accused of exploiting tragedy to further their campaigns.
lead_paragraph: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and THOMAS KAPLAN

headline.print_headline: Bloggers, Bangladesh and Insight on 39 Killings
headline.main: Bangladesh Says It Now Knows Who’s Killing the Bloggers

snippet: The police have implicated two militant groups in an accelerating series of attacks over the past three years and say they are preparing to round up their leaders....
abstract: Bangladesh's police counterterrorism chief Monirul Islam reveals what his agency has discovered about killings of at least 39 people, including bloggers and religious minorities, since February 2013; murderous campaign was conceived and carried out by Islamist militant groups Ansar al-Islam and Jama’atul Mujahedeen Bangladesh in order to discredit secularism in country.
lead_paragraph: The police have implicated two militant groups in an accelerating series of attacks over the past three years and say they are preparing to round up their leaders.

byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK
